definition[0]: to walk with difficulty, especially because your legs or feet hurt
example[0]: He hobbled into the room on crutches.
definition[1]: to deliberately make sure that a plan, system etc cannot work successfully
example[1]: Many start-ups are hobbled by a lack of sufficient capital.
explanation[0]: Hobble is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to loosely fasten two of an animalâ€™s legs together, to stop it from running away
